Line 85: Line 85:
===Election monitoring===
===Election monitoring===
â
The election would not to be under the supervision of any national court or international monitors. The General-Secretary of the Policy Committee in the [[National Democratic Party]] [[Gamal Mubarak]] said: "This issue is governed by the law and the constitution which made it possible for civil society organizations to monitor the elections."{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}} The Secretary of Education in the [[National Democratic Party|NDP]], [[Mohamed Kamal]], said that the party welcomes the supervision of national organisations, but refuses international monitoring. He also added that the abolition of judicial supervision of elections does not affect the integrity of the elections.{{Citation needed|date=September 2010}}
+
The election would not to be under the supervision of any national court or international monitors. The General-Secretary of the Policy Committee in the [[National Democratic Party]] [[Gamal Mubarak]] said: "This issue is governed by the law and the constitution which made it possible for civil society organizations to monitor the elections<ref name="Â«National Democratic PartyÂ» emphasizes the unity of the parliamentary majority to reap and rejects any international monitoring of the elections"></ref>". The Secretary of Education in the [[National Democratic Party|NDP]], [[Mohamed Kamal]], said that the party welcomes the supervision of national organisations, but refuses international monitoring. He also added that the abolition of judicial supervision of elections does not affect the integrity of the elections<ref name="Â«National Democratic PartyÂ» emphasizes the unity of the parliamentary majority to reap and rejects any international monitoring of the elections"></ref>. But there are concerns by the opposition that the persistence of the regime in power and was not prepared to abandon them under any circumstance is a major obstacle in the way of [[democracy | democratic]] which was confirmed by ''Abdel Moneim Sayyid'' Chairman of [[Al-Ahram]] and a member of the Policy Committee of the National Party to a newspaper, saying that'''"the regime will not relinquish its grip on power even if it means holding fraudulent elections."'''<ref name="The Christian Science Monitor: ElBaradei rally Egypt for reform">[http://www.Shorouknews.com/ContentData.aspx?ID=216942 The Christian Science Monitor: ElBaradei rally Egypt for reform]</ref><ref name="The Christian Science Monitor: ''Eyeing presidency'', Mohamed ElBaradei rallies Egypt for reform">[http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Middle-East/2010/0423/Eyeing-presidency-Mohamed-ElBaradei-rallies-Egypt-for-reform/(page)/2 The Christian Science Monitor: ''Eyeing presidency'', Mohamed ElBaradei rallies Egypt for reform]</ref>
